Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to interpret event log and infer phases. Identify distinct patterns. Events 1-3: low temp 20C, low vibration, flow 0, tool pos 0, low energy. Likely idle or standby.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Then event 4-6: temperature rises to 50-58, vibration spikes to 30-38, flow 5, tool position 5-10, energy rises to 2-3. This looks like cutting/machining start.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Then event 7-8: temp 40, pressure 2, vibration drops to 10, flow 2, tool pos 15, energy back to 2. Might be a transition or different stage like welding? Actually after high vibration and flow, then pressure rises to 2, vibration drops, flow reduces, tool position increases to 15, energy stable. Could be finishing or post-processing.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Event 9: temp 80, vibration 50, flow 0, tool pos 15, energy 5. High temperature and vibration but flow zero, perhaps a cooling or inspection?

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Then event 10-11-12: temp drops to 30-25, vibration low 1-5, flow 0-1, tool pos 20, energy low. This seems like post-process, maybe packaging or final inspection.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Events 13-15: back to low temperature, vibration zero, flow zero, tool pos 0, energy low, similar to idle.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Thus maybe phases: Idle/Startup (events 1-3), Cutting/Machining (events 4-6), Finishing/Tool Adjustment (events 7-8), High-Temp Operation (maybe welding?) Actually event 9 high temp 80 and high vibration 50 while flow 0 suggests maybe welding or heat treatment? Then Cool-down/Inspection (events 10-12) and then End/Idle (13-15).

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: We need assign intuitive labels: Idle/Standby, Cutting/ machining, Tool Positioning/Adjustment, Welding/High-Temp Process, Cooling/Inspection, Packaging/Finish. Provide rationale.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Lets craft answer with groups: Phase 1: Events 1-3 Idle/Preparation. Phase 2: Events 4-6 Cutting/Machining. Phase 3: Events 7-8 Tool Retraction/Positioning post-machining. Phase 4: Event 9 High-Temp Operation e.g. welding or heat treatment. Phase 5: Events 10-12 Cooling/Inspection. Phase 6: Events 13-15 Idle/End of Cycle. Explain each. Provide rationale: temperature spikes correlate with vibration and flow; tool position changes indicate movement; energy consumption patterns.
